page.title: 13FARMING IN RAGLAN
page.content: {FARMING} Lower Penyclawdd farm is a mixed farm of 130 acres.Much of the land is taken up by fertilized grassland, necessary for grazing of the sheep and cattle as well as for making silage. The farm has 200 beef cattle in the winter and in June had 120 ewes and 6 rams.The machinery on the farm includes two tractors,a manure spreader,fertilizer spreader,tedder for the hay and a rotivator,plus various trailers. Casual labour and contract labour is used occasionally at busy times such as harvesting and shearing and once a year for hedging but the rest of the year is farmed by the family. Mr. Bayliss,the farmer,attends the weekly market at Abergavenny and also goes to the annual agricultural shows at Stoneleigh and Monmouth.
